file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 33-21-05-04 - CONFIG-1 - CEILING BALLASTS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL CEILING BALLASTS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the ceiling ballasts. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT MODEL(S) 33-21-05-000-801-A CEILING BALLASTS - REMOVAL EMB-145 ACFT MODEL(S) 33-21-05-400-801-A CEILING BALLASTS - INSTALLATION EMB-145 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-1 33-21-05 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-21-05-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 2. CEILING BALLASTS - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the ceiling ballasts. (2) The ballasts are installed on the LH PSU supporting structure. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-26-04-000-801-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-006-B (1) On the LH electrical-power control/distribution box, open these circuit breakers and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE tags to them: – CABIN LIGHT 1 (Location tip: RB SERV BUS/CABIN LIGHT 1). – CABIN LIGHT 1 (Location tip: RB DC BUS 2/CABIN LIGHT 1). (2) Remove the LH wardrobe (AMM TASK 25-26-04-000-801-A/400), if applicable. (3) Open the PSU assembly, as applicable. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-006-B (1) Disconnect the two electrical connectors (4) (5). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 33-21-05 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Remove the screw (6) and washer (7) that attach the ballast (8) to the PSU support structure. (3) Remove the screw (1), lock washer (10), and washers (2) (9) that attach the terminal lug (3) to the ballast (8). (4) Remove the ballast (8). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 33-21-05 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 Cabin Light Ballast - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONES 231 243 253 263 B PSU ASSEMBLY (REF.) DET. A 1. SCREW 2. WASHER 4. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR 3. TERMINAL LUG 10. LOCK WASHER 6. SCREW 9. WASHER 7. WASHER 8. BALLAST 5. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR DET. B (TYPICAL) 145AMM330800.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 33-21-05 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-21-05-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 3. CEILING BALLASTS - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the ceiling sidewall ballasts. (2) The ballasts are installed on the LH PSU supporting structure. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION ELECTRICAL BONDING TEST - STANDARD PROCE- AMM TASK 20-13-21-700-801-A/200 DURES TYPES OF ELECTRICAL BONDING AND SURFACE AMM TASK 20-13-21-910-801-A/200 PREPARATION - STANDARD PROCEDURES ELECTRICAL BONDING PROTECTION - STANDARD AMM TASK 20-13-21-910-802-A/200 PROCEDURES AMM TASK 25-26-04-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 33-21-00-700-801-A/500 PASSENGER CABIN LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL TEST C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-006-B (1) Do the bonding procedure, method 3 (AMM TASK 20-13-21-910-801-A/200). (2) Put the ballast (8) in position. (3) Tighten the screw (6) and washer (7) that attach the ballast (8) to the PSU supporting structure. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 33-21-05 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Connect the terminal lug (3) to the ballast with the screw (1), lock washer (10), and washers (2) (9). (5) Tighten the screw (1), lock washer (10), and washers (2) (9) that attach the terminal lug to the ballast. (6) Do the bonding test (AMM TASK 20-13-21-700-801-A/200). (7) Do the bonding protection ( AMM TASK 20-13-21-910-802-A/200). (8) Connect the two electrical connectors (4) (5) to the ballast (8). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-006-B (1) On the LH electrical-power control/distribution box, remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tags from these circuit breakers and close them: – CABIN LIGHT 1 (Location tip: RB SERV BUS/CABIN LIGHT 1). – CABIN LIGHT 1 (Location tip: RB DC BUS 2/CABIN LIGHT 1). (2) Close the PSU assembly, as applicable. (3) Install the LH wardrobe (AMM TASK 25-26-04-000-801-A/400), if applicable. (4) Do the cabin-light operational test ( AMM TASK 33-21-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 33-21-05 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
